content: The following lists events that happened during **1959 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [Governor of Singapore](/wiki/Governor_of_Singapore) - Sir [William Allmond Codrington Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) ( until 2 June) - [Yang di-Pertuan Negara](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Negara) - Sir [William Allmond Codrington Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) (from 3 June to 2 December) - [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) (from 3 December) - [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore) – [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) (until June 3) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) – [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) (from 5 June) - [Chief Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): [Edgeworth Beresford David](/wiki/Edgeworth_Beresford_David) (till 2 June) ## Events ### May - 30 May – The [1959 General Elections](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election) was held. Lee Kuan Yew was elected as [Prime Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore). ### June - 3 June – The 1958 State of Singapore Constitution is adopted, allowing for self-governance in Singapore. - 5 June – The first [Cabinet](/wiki/First_Lee_Kuan_Yew_Cabinet) is sworn into power. - 8 June – A campaign against decadent lifestyles is launched. - 20 June – The [Ministry of National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore)) will start a team with seven Assembly members from 22 June, with many departments to be consolidated under MND. The [Singapore Improvement Trust](/wiki/Singapore_Improvement_Trust) will also be brought under the Ministry in future. - 25 June – The Ministry of National Development forms the Primary Production Department to better serve farmers and fishermen. ### October - 23 October – Various departments of the City Council and Rural Board will be absorbed into the Ministry of National Development, [Ministry of Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)) and Ministry of Labour and Law. ### November - 11 November- The National Anthem "[Majulah Singapura](/wiki/Majulah_Singapura)" was selected as the National Anthem of Singapore. ### December - 3 December – [Encik Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Encik_Yusof_bin_Ishak) is sworn in as Singapore's second [Yang di-Pertuan Negara](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Negara). On the same day, the National [Flag of Singapore](/wiki/Flag_of_Singapore), the [Coat of arms of Singapore](/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Singapore) and the national anthem, [Majulah Singapura](/wiki/Majulah_Singapura), are unveiled. - 12–17 December – Singapore participates in the [1959 Southeast Asian Peninsular Games](/wiki/1959_Southeast_Asian_Peninsular_Games), the first SEAP event. It came in fourth with 33 medals. ## Births - 9 February – [Gan Kim Yong](/wiki/Gan_Kim_Yong), [Minister for Trade and Industry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Trade_and_Industry_(Singapore)). - 26 February – [Lim Hwee Hua](/wiki/Lim_Hwee_Hua), former politician, first woman in Singapore's Cabinet. - 12 March – [Kenneth Jeyaratnam](/wiki/Kenneth_Jeyaretnam), politician and hedge fund manager. - 26 March – [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam), [Minister for Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) and [Minister for Law](/wiki/Ministry_of_Law_(Singapore)). - 24 June – [Raymond Lim](/wiki/Raymond_Lim), former politician. - 25 September – [Leong Mun Wai](/wiki/Leong_Mun_Wai), politician and former investment banker. - 25 November – [Marrie Lee](/wiki/Marrie_Lee), director, producer, writer and actress. - 9 December – [Denise Phua](/wiki/Denise_Phua), politician. ## Deaths - 14 March – [Tan Thoon Lip](/wiki/Tan_Thoon_Lip), lawyer and public official (b. 1910). - 30 March – [James Lornie](/wiki/James_Lornie), Scottish colonial administrator (b. 1876). - 5 April – [Teo Eng Hock](/wiki/Teo_Eng_Hock), rubber tycoon and one of the founders of the Singapore branch of the [Tongmenghui](/wiki/Tongmenghui) (b. 1872). - [List of years in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_years_in_Singapore) - [1959 Singaporean general election](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election) - (/wiki/1959) This Singapore-related article is a stub.
